info.description:
The Bulk Data Insertion API (BDIA) endpoint allows clients to send bulk hit/event data into Analytics. 

 Note: Adobe may add optional request and response members (name/value pairs) to existing API objects at any time and without notice or changes in versioning. Adobe recommends that you refer to the API documentation of any third-party tool you integrate with our APIs so that such additions are ignored in processing if not understood. If implemented properly, such additions are non-breaking changes for your implementation. Adobe will not remove parameters or add required parameters without first providing standard notification through release notes.
info.title: Bulk Data Insertion API (BDIA)

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: The access token copied from your AA API client integration, prefixed with "Bearer ".

x-api-key.name: x-api-key
x-api-key.description: The API key copied from your AA API client integration. For more information on how to obtain this value, see [Getting started with the CJA API](https://developer.adobe.com/cja-apis/docs/getting-started/).

post.description:
Upload a batch file to Analytics for processing. Uploaded files must:
 * Be 100 MB or less compressed (using gzip)
* Follow the CSV formatting rules and include the required fields as specified in the documentation

parameters.name: globalCompanyId
parameters.description: The Global Company ID for the Adobe Analytics organization

parameters.name: x-adobe-vgid
parameters.description: Visitor Group ID. A visitor group represents a bucketed group of visitor IDs that are separate from any other visitor group set. The Group ID is a string of any valid value, but must be consistent across files. See [Vistior groups] (https://developer.adobe.com/analytics-apis/docs/2.0/guides/endpoints/bulk-data-insertion/visitor-groups/) for more information.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Gzip compressed CSV file sent with request

parameters.name: debug
parameters.description: Store debug information for the first 10 hits of the file

post.description: Upload batch file for Analytics validation. This file is not stored on the server or processed into Analytics. Validation is only for testing file format.

parameters.name: globalCompanyId
parameters.description: The Global Company ID for the Adobe Analytics organization

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Gzip compressed CSV file sent with request

file_id.description: The file ID as a GUID

visitor_group_id.description: The visitor group of the file

size.description: The size of the compressed file in bytes

received_date.description: The date the file was uploaded in unix epoch time.

processing_start_date.description: The starting date for processing, in unix epoch time.

processing_end_date.description: The date all hits were submitted for Analytics, in unix epoch time.

file_reader_complete_date.description: The date the file was completely read, but the hits not yet submitted, in unix epoch time.

rows.description: The number of rows in the file

invalid_rows.description: The number of rows not submitted to analytics for being invalid

upload_name.description: The file name as it was uploaded

status_code.description: The status of the file as a short name

processing_log.description: A log of errors produced while processing the file

error.description: An error message for unsuccessful requests

success.description: A success message for validation requests
